subclusters.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on insulin/IGF-1 signaling and nutrient-sensing pathways driving late-life hyperfunction causing aging, emphasizing functional tradeoffs and modulation of these pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes the IIS/TOR network's role in lifespan and immunity regulation via nutrient sensing, fitting the insulin/IGF-1 and nutrient-sensing hyperfunction theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IIS/TOR pathway genetic regulation of lifespan and nutrient-dependent modulation, aligning with insulin/IGF-1 and nutrient-sensing hyperfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes anabolic pathway hyperfunction (GH/IGF-1 and mTOR) and antagonistic pleiotropy, fitting the insulin/IGF-1 and nutrient-sensing hyperfunction subcluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IIS and mTORC1 regulation in muscle aging and mitochondrial integrity, highlighting insulin/IGF-1 nutrient-sensing hyperfunction mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on TOR nutrient-sensing pathway regulating lifespan and growth, with rapamycin extending lifespan, fitting nutrient-sensing hyperfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Sch9/AGC kinase nutrient-sensing signaling regulating aging, a conserved nutrient-sensitive growth pathway related to TOR and insulin signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on TOR signaling and S6 kinase in nutrient sensing and life history traits, fitting nutrient-sensing hyperfunction mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Milk activates mTORC1 via nutrient signaling, promoting growth and aging, fitting nutrient-sensing hyperfunction driven by dietary signals.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Sestrin-mediated amino acid sensing regulates TORC1 and stem cell function, linking nutrient sensing to aging, fitting this subcluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and Nutrient-Sensing Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR inhibition extends lifespan by affecting multiple mechanisms including metabolism and immunity, fitting nutrient-sensing hyperfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTOR hyperactivation causing stem/progenitor cell dysfunction and senescence, emphasizing mTOR-driven cellular aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mTORC1 hyperactivation driving stem cell aging and dysfunction, with rapamycin rescuing these effects, fitting mTOR-driven senescence and stem cell decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mTOR-driven geroconversion from arrest to senescence and hypoxia-mediated suppression, focusing on mTOR's role in cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTOR pathway driving geroconversion and cellular senescence, with hypoxia suppressing this process, fitting mTOR-driven senescence mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR regulates senescence and autophagy affecting stem cell renewal and aging, emphasizing mTOR's role in stem cell aging and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR signaling regulates stem cell function and exhaustion, linking cellular growth signals to systemic aging, fitting mTOR-driven stem cell dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: TOR hyperactivation causes stem cell aging and senescence; rapamycin rejuvenates stem cells, fitting mTOR-driven cellular senescence and stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR mediates Wnt-induced epidermal stem cell exhaustion via senescence, linking mTOR-driven hyperfunction to stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS activates mTOR causing cellular senescence, linking mitochondrial stress to mTOR-driven senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTORC1 signaling dysregulation drives aging and age-related decline; rapamycin extends lifespan by modulating autophagy and translation, fitting mTOR-driven senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR drives growth and aging via hyperfunction and antagonistic pleiotropy, linking mTOR activity to cellular hyperfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mTOR drives cellular senescence and SASP, promoting aging via hyperfunctional secretory phenotype, fitting mTOR-driven senescence mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: TOR signaling drives quasi-programmed aging via cellular hyperfunction, hypertrophy, and autophagy inhibition, fitting mTOR-driven cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hyperfunction theory emphasizing mTOR and other pathways driving aging as quasi-program, with rapamycin slowing geroconversion and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Runaway developmental programs mediated by GH/IGF-1/TOR cause hyperfunction and aging, fitting mTOR-driven cellular hyperfunction and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Quasi-programmed aging driven by TOR pathway hyperfunction causing hypertrophy and secondary decline, fitting mTOR-driven aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hyperfunction theory focusing on TOR kinase pathway driving hypertrophy and pathology as a quasi-program, fitting mTOR-driven cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR and AMPK Longevity Pathways Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTOR inhibition and AMPK activation as core longevity pathways modulating metabolism, inflammation, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR Complexes Balance in Reproductive Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance of mTORC1 and mTORC2 in Sertoli cells regulating sperm epigenetic aging, a distinct mTOR complexes balance mechanism in reproductive aging.
